description: From Urdu دروان‎ (darvān) and Hindi दरवान (darvān), from Persian دروان‎ (darvân), from دربان‎ (darbân, “doorkeeper”), from در‎ (dar, “door”) + بان‎ (-bân, “keeper, guardian”).

entries.meaning: (India) A live-in doorkeeper, especially in an apartment building.
examples: Outside my retreat, our house was full of relatives and other people.  […]  Mukundalal the durwan is outside rolling on the ground with the one-eyed wrestler, trying out a new wrestling fall.
